title: Online Discussion-Based Microlearning for Improving Medical Interview Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of basic medical terminology and foundational patient communication concepts
context.additional_context: Learning the cognitive foundations of medical interview skills through asynchronous discussions and video learning accessible via smartphones, reinforced by project-based assessment and peer feedback.

learning_goals: Learners can explain core concepts such as open-ended questioning, active listening, and response analysis during patient interviews.
Learners can improve interview scenarios by over 80% based on peer feedback in asynchronous discussions.
Learners can apply a 3-stage model (preparation-execution-reflection) to structure medical interview processes in real-world cases.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
